Description: Rim and body sherd of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; top of lip glazed; exterior: dilute banding on lip; band at top of handle zone, the rest reserved; wall glazed; inscription on exterior.
Type series: Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type A2
Curator's comments: Schlotzhauer identifies this sherd as coming from a Type 5C South Ionian cup with everted rim. These cups are both the earliest South Ionian cups at Naukratis and are relatively rare at the site. These cups coincide with Petrie’s class L1 (Petrie 1886, 18), Hayes' Ionian Type IX (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116), and Vallet and Villard's Ionian Cup Type A2 (Vallet and Villard, 1964, 87-88). These cups were common drinking vessels, not just in the Greek sanctuaries at Naukratis, but elsewhere as well, including the sanctuary of Aphrodite at Miletus. The number in Petrie 1886, 143, is written in ink on the exterior surface of the sherd.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXII, no. 143)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 653, no. 104)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 49, no. 3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.090) (Phase 3)
